Name: dioxane production | dioxane | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: 1,4-Dioxane is manufactured commercially by the dehydration and ring closure of diethylene glycol. Concentrated sulfuric acid (ca. 5 %) is used as a catalyst. Operating conditions vary; temperatures  range from 130 to 200 °C and pressures range from a slight pressure to a partial vacuum (25 –110 kPa). A favorable temperature  is reported to be 160 °C. The process is continuous, with 1,4-dioxane vaporized from the reaction vessel. The vapors are passed  through an acid trap and two distillation columns to remove water and to purify the product. Yields of ca. 90 % are possible.  2-Methyl-1,3-dioxolane, acetaldehyde, crotonaldehyde, and polyglycol are unwanted byproducts.;References:;Surprenant, K.: Dioxane.  In: Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Seventh Edition, 2004 Electronic Release (ed. Fiedler E., Grossmann G., Kersebohm D., Weiss G. and Witte C.). 7th Electronic Release Edition.
